selected_quotes: The past, present and future of reprogramming: an interview with @GurdonInstitute's John Gurdon by @AidMaart
This really is a fantastic piece! An interview with John Gurdon Development
This one will run and run - words from our inspirational Distinguished Group Leader, who 'doesn't read books'
we take the view that the egg does a rather better job reversing differentiation compared with overexpressing TFs
We interviewed Sirs John and Jim this year

citation.abstract: John Gurdon is a Distinguished Group Leader in the Wellcome Trust/Cancer Research UK Gurdon Institute and Professor Emeritus in the Department of Zoology at the University of Cambridge. In 2012, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine jointly with Shinya Yamanaka for work on the reprogramming of mature cells to pluripotency, and his lab continues to investigate the molecular mechanisms of nuclear reprogramming by oocytes and eggs. We met John in his Cambridge office to discuss his career and hear his thoughts on the past, present and future of reprogramming.
citation.publisher: Oxford University Press for The Company of Biologists Limited
citation.title: An interview with John Gurdon

facebook.title: Timeline Photos
facebook.summary:
[From Entomology to Embryology: John Gurdon 的第一篇論文]

John Gurdon 為 2012 年諾貝爾生理醫學獎得主，以劃時代的蛙細胞核移植技術聞名全球。 最近一期的 Development 刊出他的訪談實錄，第一段即令人驚訝地披露是他生平第一篇論文竟是昆蟲分類的報導 (見照片)。其鍥而不捨的精神，和其後來的學術成就，相信對昆蟲系的同學有莫大的啟示和鼓舞！(http://dev.biologists.org/content/144/9/1581)

P.S.
